channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: スタジオ幹部は過去10年間、シリコンバレーの超成長と破壊という魔法の思考を受け入れてきたが、好景気の終焉とともに労働者の給与を削減することになった（Brian Merchant/Los Angeles Times）
item.description:
Brian Merchant / Los Angeles Times:
Studio executives embraced Silicon Valley's magical thinking of hypergrowth and disruption for the past 10 years, only to slash worker pay as the boom times end  —  In one respect, the actors and writers of Hollywood uniting on the picket lines in a historic, industry-shaking strike is a tale as old as time …

item.title: 韓国とインドの映画製作者は、ハリウッドのストライキが米国のストリーミング・サービスとの交渉力を高め、それに続く前例となることを期待している（Washington Post紙）
item.description:
Washington Post:
South Korean and Indian filmmakers are hoping the Hollywood strikes will give them more bargaining power with US streaming services and a precedent to follow  —  SEOUL — When Netflix launched in South Korea in 2016, it was a breath of fresh air for filmmakers jaded by a local industry notorious for labor abuses and penny-pinching.

item.title: 月間読者数3,000万人、購読者数70万人を誇るアルゼンチンのクラール＆アキュートンは、サービスの多様化と他市場への進出を模索している（Brian Veseling/WAN-IFRA）
item.description:
Brian Veseling / WAN-IFRA:
A look at Argentina's Clarín, which has 30M monthly readers and 700K subscribers, as the outlet looks to diversify their offerings and expand into other markets  —  “Clarín is the only Latin American media outlet to be ranked among the top 20 in digital subscribers.

item.title: イーロン・マスクは7月24日、「そしてまもなく、我々はツイッターブランドに別れを告げなければならない」「もし今夜、十分に良いXのロゴが投稿されれば、我々は世界中でライブ中継を行う」とツイートした（Rishabh Jaiswal/Reuters）
item.description:
Rishabh Jaiswal / Reuters:
Elon Musk tweets “And soon we shall bid adieu to the twitter brand” and “If a good enough X logo is posted tonight, we'll make go live worldwide” on July 24  —  Elon Musk said he was looking to change Twitter's logo, tweeting: “And soon we shall bid adieu to the twitter brand and, gradually, all the birds.

item.title: ハリウッドを混乱に陥れている俳優と脚本家のストライキを紹介。高価な映画の遅延、ギャラ争い、AIへの不安などを引き起こしている（Variety誌）
item.description:
Variety:
A look at the actors' and writers' strikes that are plunging Hollywood into chaos, causing pricey movie delays, pay battles, AI anxiety, and more  —  It was a typical day on the set of “Gladiator 2” in Malta.  British director Ridley Scott was orchestrating a complex sequence featuring the film's star …

item.title: ジョージ・フロイドの抗議が資金援助の波を引き寄せてから3年、黒人ジャーナリズムの起業家たちは、ニュースルームを維持するのに苦労していると言う（Uyiosa Elegon/The Objective）。
item.description:
Uyiosa Elegon / The Objective:
Three years after the George Floyd protests drew a wave of financial support, Black journalism entrepreneurs say they are struggling to sustain their newsrooms  —  Many Black-led outlets — digital and legacy media alike — are still trying to figure out how to sustain their work.

item.title: 創設者がThe Federalist SocietyやRealClearPoliticsとつながりのあるPublir広告ネットワークと、Publirがドナルド・フォーラムにどのように広告収入を流しているかを見てみよう（Check My Ads Institute）。
item.description:
Check My Ads Institute:
A look at the Publir ad network, whose founders have ties to The Federalist Society and RealClearPolitics, and how Publir funnels ad revenue to The Donald forum  —  At the end of 2022, The_Donald quietly started running ads.  —  The_Donald, a MAGA forum banned by Reddit for its role …

item.title: 情報筋ジェフ・ベゾス氏はワシントン・ポスト紙の運営により積極的な役割を果たそうとしている。
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Jeff Bezos is taking a more active role in The Washington Post's operations as staff morale craters and the newspaper is on pace to lose ~$100M in 2023  —  The Amazon founder, who purchased The Washington Post for $250 million in 2013, has taken a more active role in the paper's operations this year.

item.title: ハリウッドのストライキを長引かせることで、ディズニー、NBCユニバーサル、パラマウントのようなレガシー企業は、伝統的なネットワークTVモデルが壊滅するリスクを負う（Josef Adalian/Vulture）
item.description:
Josef Adalian / Vulture:
By letting the Hollywood strike drag on, legacy companies like Disney, NBCUniversal, and Paramount risk the devastation of the traditional network TV model  —  This story first ran in Buffering, Vulture's newsletter about the streaming industry.  Head to vulture.com/buffering and subscribe today!

item.title: テキサスA&M学長、黒人ジャーナリスト、キャスリーン・マッケロイの採用失敗をめぐる政治介入疑惑を教員から批判され辞任（ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
New York Times:
Texas A&M's president resigns after faculty members criticized alleged political meddling in the school's failed hiring of Black journalist Kathleen McElroy  —  The university said M. Katherine Banks would retire “immediately” after political pushback over the effort to appoint Kathleen McElroy to lead its journalism program.

item.title: Twitter、Twitter Blueを持たないアカウントが送信できるダイレクトメッセージの数に「1日あたりの制限」を設定、DMのスパムを減らすための変更の一環（Michael Kan/PCMag）
item.description:
Michael Kan / PCMag:
Twitter sets “daily limits” on the number of direct messages that accounts without Twitter Blue can send, as part of changes to reduce spam in DMs  —  It looks like Elon Musk really wants users to pay for Twitter Blue. … In another controversial change, Twitter will restrict …

item.title: ジャーナリスト、ティモシー・バークの弁護団が、米司法省に彼の機材の返却を求める申し立てを提出、物議を醸したフォックス・ニュースのビデオテイクを合法的に入手したことを主張（Justin Garcia/Tampa Bay Times）。
item.description:
Justin Garcia / Tampa Bay Times:
Lawyers for journalist Timothy Burke file a motion demanding the US DOJ return his equipment and argue he legally obtained controversial Fox News video outtakes  —  Burke's legal team says his phone and computers were seized “in violation of the law.”  —  Tim Burke's home office is gutted.

item.title: AMPTPは23ページの文書で、交渉が決裂しストライキが始まる前の7月13日時点の交渉状況について、SAG-AFTRAの「誤解を招く」主張に反論している（David Robb/Deadline）
item.description:
David Robb / Deadline:
In a 23-page document, the AMPTP disputes SAG-AFTRA's “misleading” claims of the negotiations status as of July 13, before talks broke off and the strike began  —  UPDATED with SAG-AFTRA response: The Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers is disputing SAG-AFTRA's …

item.title: ケベック州の一部のラジオ局やニュース局は、フェイスブックやインスタグラムのニュースリンクをブロックするメタ社の計画をカナダ人に知らせる広告の掲載を拒否している（Marie Woolf/Globe and Mail）。
item.description:
Marie Woolf / Globe and Mail:
Some Quebec radio stations and news outlets refuse to run Meta's ads that inform Canadians of the company's plan to block news links on Facebook and Instagram  —  Meta has started to run ads to inform Canadians of its plan to block the viewing and sharing of news content on Facebook …

item.title: 情報筋スポティファイ、米国の広告なしプレミアム・ティアを初めて値上げし、月額10.99ドルに。
item.description:
Anne Steele / Wall Street Journal:
Sources: Spotify plans to raise its US ad-free premium tier's price for the first time, by $1 to $10.99/month, and increase prices globally in the coming months  —  Audio company had avoided raising prices, but faces investor pressure to increase profitability
